statement.p: Do eigenvalues change under row operations?
If Av = \lambda v with v \neq 0 and A is invertible, can you find an eigenvalue/eigenvector of A\inv? Can A has a zero eigenvalue?
If Av = \lambda v and k is a positive integer, explain why v is an eigenvector for A^k, and what is the corresponding eigenvalue?
If \lambda_1, \lambda_2 are distinct eigenvalues of A explain why the corresponding eigenvectors v_1, v_2 are linearly independent. Is 2v_1-3v_2 an eigenvector for A?
Why do BAB\inv and A^T have the same eigenvalues?
